page.title: 08THE RIVERSIDE MUSEUM:TILBURY
page.content:
The Museum was opened in 1977. Usually there is only one person in charge. The workers are employed by the local council. The oldest thing on display is some{Tudor glass}found near the River Thames.
The most valuable exhibits are the models of the ships. Inside the museum they have the bell of{HMS ESSEX}that was donated by the Navy. All the exhibits are connected with the river in some way. The articles in the museum are either given, bought or found. The lady at the museum enjoys her work.
